text.section: The composition of the Advisory Board shall reflect the racial and gender diversity of the population of the State.

section.section: Except for the Secretary, the term of an Advisory Board member is 2 years.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

text.section: The Governor may remove a member of the Advisory Board for incompetence, misconduct, or failure to perform the duties of the position.
The Governor shall select a chair from among the members of the Advisory Board.
The Advisory Board may act with an affirmative vote of eight members.

A member of the Advisory Board:
may not receive compensation as a member of the Advisory Board; but
is entitled to reimbursement for expenses under the Standard State Travel Regulations, as provided in the State budget.
